alert.note: Alert for Armstrong (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 7:27PM EST until February 19 at 12:43AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Allegheny River At Mosgrove affecting Armstrong County.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC005-190545- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0012.000000T0000Z-220219T0543Z/ /MOSP1.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 727 PM EST Fri Feb 18 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Allegheny River at Mosgrove. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Navigation suspended. Lock out of service. At 15.8 feet, Lock walls are overtopped. At 20.0 feet, Water begins to rise on to the road along the river in Templeton PA. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting and will fall to 13.3 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
